sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingGroup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getColspan colspan} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

insertAction.!description: Inserts a action into the aggregation actions.

parameters.oAction: type: sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup, description: the action to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the action should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the action is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the action is inserted at the last position

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

parameters.bColspan: type: boolean, description: New value for property colspan

setSupplyActive.!description: Sets a new value for property supplyActive. The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false. The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bSupplyActive: type: boolean, description: New value for property supplyActive

getAutoActivateSupply.!description: Gets current value of property autoActivateSupply. If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically set to true on every unselect. Default value is false.

setShowSubAttributesIndicator.!description: Sets a new value for property showSubAttributesIndicator. Specifies whether the attribute shall have sub values for visual purposes. The indicator which is a little arrow beside an attribute in the list is computed automatically (getShowSubAttributesIndicator_Computed() of sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute). In the case that a supply function is attached, and the supplyActive attribute has value 'true', then the Exact pattern needs a hint if sub attributes are available. The showSubAttributesIndicator attribute is considered then and has to be maintained. If the back-end does not support count-calls, for example, showSubAttributesIndicator should be set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowSubAttributesIndicator: type: boolean, description: New value for property showSubAttributesIndicator

getSupplyActive.!description: Gets current value of property supplyActive. The supplyAttributes event is only fired if supplyActive has value true which is the default. After firing the event, the attribute is automatically set to false. The idea is that a supply function is called only once when the data is requested. To enable the event again it is possible to manually set the attribute back to true. Default value is true.

parameters.sText: type: string, description: New value for property text

destroyAttributes.!description: Destroys all the attributes in the aggregation attributes.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500. Default value is 168.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property width. Specifies the width of the corresponding list in pixels. The value must be between 70 and 500. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 168.

parameters.iWidth: type: int, description: New value for property width

attachSupplyAttributes.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the supplyAttributes event of this sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute itself. A supply function is a handler which is attached to the supplyAttributes event. The event is fired when the corresponding ExactAttribute is selected, it was already selected when a handler is attached or function getAttributes() is called.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExactAttribute. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean
    • {@link #getWidth width} : int (default: 168)
    • {@link #getListOrder listOrder} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder (default: Select)
    • {@link #getShowSubAttributesIndicator showSubAttributesIndicator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAdditionalData additionalData} : object
    • {@link #getSupplyActive supplyActive} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoActivateSupply autoActivateSupply} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:supplyAttributes supplyAttributes} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getListOrder.!description: Gets current value of property listOrder. The order how the sublists of this attribute should be displayed. Default value is Select.

setAutoActivateSupply.!description: Sets a new value for property autoActivateSupply. If you want the supply function to be called on every select, you can set the autoActivateSupply attribute to true. In this case, supplyActive is automatically set to true on every unselect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bAutoActivateSupply: type: boolean, description: New value for property autoActivateSupply

sap.ui.ux3.CollectionInspector.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CollectionInspector. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getSidebarVisible sidebarVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFitParent fitParent} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCollections collections} : sap.ui.ux3.Collection[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedCollection selectedCollection} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.Collection)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:collectionSelected collectionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:itemSelectionChanged itemSelectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editCollection editCollection} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new NavigationBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getToplevelVariant toplevelVariant} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOverflowItemsToUpperCase overflowItemsToUpperCase} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
    • {@link #getAssociatedItems associatedItems} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getOverflowItemsToUpperCase.!description: Gets current value of property overflowItemsToUpperCase. Sets the appearance of the menu items in the overflow menu to uppercase Default value is false.

getSelectedItem.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association selectedItem, or null.

setAssociatedItems.!description: Replaces the currently associated items with the ones in the given array

parameters.aItems: type: sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[], description: The items to associate

removeAssociatedItem.!description: Removes an associatedItem from the association named associatedItems.

parameters.vAssociatedItem: type: int|sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem, description: The associatedItem to be removed or its index or ID

sap.ui.ux3.NavigationBar.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.IconTabBar, sap.m.TabContainer or sap.uxap.ObjectPageLayout control.
Provides enhanced navigation capabilities and is the parent control of NavigationItem. It is displayed in the form of a horizontal line with switching markers depending on the currently selected item. The size of an item which is currently chosen by the user is enlarged. In the case that a large number of items are defined for the bar, this is made transparent to the user by showing symbols for scrolling options (forwards and backwards) to see the next or previous items.

getAssociatedItems.!description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association associatedItems.

getItems.!description: Gets content of aggregation items. If the navigation items need to have a different parent than the NavigationBar, alternatively the associatedItems association can be used. The NavigationBar follows the approach to use the items aggregation. If this aggregation is empty, associatedItems is used.

isSelectedItemValid.!description: Returns whether there is a selectedItem set which is actually present in the items aggregation; or, if the aggregation is empty, in the associatedItems association.

destroyItems.!description: Destroys all the items in the aggregation items.

removeAllItems.!description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation items. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

insertItem.!description: Inserts a item into the aggregation items.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position
parameters.oItem: type: sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem, description: the item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

openPane.!description:
Opens the side Pane.

A valid ID of a paneBarItem must be given, so this item can be marked as selected. A "paneBarItemSelected" event is then fired as if the opening was triggered by the user by a click on the respective PaneBarItem.
This method can be called (with different IDs) even when the Pane is already open. It has then the same effect as if the user switches between PaneBarItems.

Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

parameters.sPaneBarItemId: type: string, description: The ID of the PaneBarItem which should be marked as selected.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.Shell itself. Fired when a workset item was selected by the user. The application may populate the sub-items of the given workset item in the event handler, but this must happen synchronously. If this is done, the application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one of the newly created sub-items. The Shell will currently always mark the first sub-item as selected.

setPaneContent.!description:
Replaces the existing side pane content with the given Control(-Tree). This method is optimized to only re-render the pane content (and not the shell) which is faster and smoother than any other way of changing the "paneContent" aggregation.

By default, the old pane content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The new Pane content. In this method it must be exactly one control (-tree). This could likely be a layout or a specific ux3 Pane control. Use addPaneContent() to add more control (-trees) to the Pane.
parameters.bDestroyOldContent: type: boolean, description: If set, the controls previously contained in the pane will be destroyed, to avoid memory leaks.

If the appIcon is set, for accessibility reasons the appIconTooltip must also be set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

sap.ui.ux3.Shell.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Shell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getAppTitle appTitle} : string
    • {@link #getAppIcon appIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAppIconTooltip appIconTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowLogoutButton showLogoutButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLogoutButtonTooltip logoutButtonTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getShowSearchTool showSearchTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowInspectorTool showInspectorTool} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFeederTool showFeederTool} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTools showTools} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPane showPane} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellHeaderType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getDesignType designType} : sap.ui.ux3.ShellDesignType (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getPaneWidth paneWidth} : int (default: 250)
    • {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFullHeightContent fullHeightContent} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAllowOverlayHeaderAccess allowOverlayHeaderAccess} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getWorksetItems worksetItems} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getPaneBarItems paneBarItems} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getPaneContent paneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getToolPopups toolPopups} : sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup[]
    • {@link #getHeaderItems headerItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getNotificationBar notificationBar} : sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedWorksetItem selectedWorksetItem} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:worksetItemSelected worksetItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneBarItemSelected paneBarItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:logout logout} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paneClosed paneClosed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setOffsetRight.!description:
Moves the complete Shell away from the right window border by the given number of pixels (left border in RTL case).

So there is space for a sidebar or so outside the Shell. The CSS class 'sapUiUx3ShellOuterSideBar' provides the basic position
capabilities for the sidebar DOM element.

This feature is not public. The usage is only granted to special groups on request.
setOffsetRight.!type: fn(px: Number, complete?: fn(), outerId?: String)

parameters.px: type: int, description: how many pixels of free space should be next to the Shell (between 0 and 600)
parameters.complete: type: function, description: optional callback function to call after the animation
parameters.outerId: type: string, description: optional id of the content representing the outside sidebar. If specified the width of the content is animated.

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

setContent.!description:
Replaces the existing Shell content with the given Control(-Tree). Only leads to a re-rendering of the content area (not the complete Shell).
This method may be more convenient than a series of calls to "removeContent" and "addContent", which each lead to a re-rendering of the content area (but again not of the complete Shell).

By default the old content is not destroyed and is returned by this method in an array for further usage. To avoid memory leaks, the old content should be destroyed (if not needed later), by setting the "destroyOldContent" flag or by destroying it manually later on. If "destroyOldContent" is set, an empty array is returned.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The new Content. In this method it must be exactly one control (-tree). Use addContent() to add more control (-trees) to the main content area of the Shell.
parameters.bDestroyOldContent: type: boolean, description: If set, the controls previously contained in the Shell will be destroyed, to avoid memory leaks.

fireWorksetItemSelected.!description:
Fires event worksetItemSelected to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • id of type stringThe id of the workset item that has been newly selected by the user. If a top-level item has been clicked which has sub-items, the ID of the currently active sub-item (/leaf) is given.
  • item of type sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItemThe selected NavigationItem
  • key of type stringThe key of the selected NavigationItem (or null if there is no key)

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

removeAllPaneBarItems.!description: Removes all the controls from the aggregation paneBarItems. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DataSetItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getIconSrc iconSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: Title)
    • {@link #getCheckable checkable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string (default: Subtitle)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selected selected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

attachSelected.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the selected event of this sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem itself. Event Fired when Datset item is selected.
attachSelected.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem

sap.ui.ux3.Exact.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Exact. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getResultText resultText} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSettingsMenu settingsMenu} : sap.ui.commons.Menu
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:refineSearch refineSearch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.Exact itself. Event which is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
attachRefineSearch.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.Exact

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

sap.ui.ux3.Feed.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Feed. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFeederThumbnailSrc feederThumbnailSrc} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getFeederSender feederSender} : string
    • {@link #getLive live} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[]
    • {@link #getChunks chunks} : sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk[]
    • {@link #getToolsMenuItems toolsMenuItems} : sap.ui.commons.MenuItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:filterChange filterChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:chunkAdded chunkAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toolsItemSelected toolsItemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:toggleLive toggleLive} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

The unit that is embedded - single-wise or in a multiple way - into a Feed control. The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp, comments, and functions such as flagging the entry to be favorite, shared, or flagged.

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

setEnableFavorite.!description: Sets a new value for property enableFavorite. If true the favorite action is enabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnableFavorite: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableFavorite

setFlagged.!description: Sets a new value for property flagged. Defines whether the entry is flagged. This property is not supported for comment chunks. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bFlagged: type: boolean, description: New value for property flagged

bindActionMenuItems.!description: Binds aggregation actionMenuItems to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindAggregation ManagedObject.bindAggregation} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo.

parameters.oBindingInfo: type: object, description: The binding information

getEnableShare.!description: Gets current value of property enableShare. If true the share action is enabled. Default value is true.

detachReferenceClicked.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the referenceClicked event of this sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

insertComment.!description: Inserts a comment into the aggregation comments.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the comment should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the comment is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the comment is inserted at the last position
parameters.oComment: type: sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk, description: the comment to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

fireToggleFlagged.!description:
Fires event toggleFlagged to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • flagged of type booleanCurrent flagged state

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

destroyComments.!description: Destroys all the comments in the aggregation comments.

getText.!description: Gets current value of property text. The FeedChunk text. @References are supported.

detachSenderClicked.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the senderClicked event of this sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

getTimestamp.!description: Gets current value of property timestamp. Format is ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ, Z meaning the time is in UTC time zone

getDeletionAllowed.!description: Gets current value of property deletionAllowed. Flag if the deletion of the chunk shall be allowed Default value is false.

getEnableInspect.!description: Gets current value of property enableInspect. If true the inspect action is enabled. Default value is true.

parameters.sThumbnailSrc: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property thumbnailSrc

indexOfComment.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk in the aggregation comments. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oComment: type: sap.ui.ux3.FeedChunk, description: The comment whose index is looked for

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

setEnableInspect.!description: Sets a new value for property enableInspect. If true the inspect action is enabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

getSender.!description: Gets current value of property sender. Sender of the chunk

setFeederSender.!description: Sets a new value for property feederSender. Sender for the comment feeder This property is optional if the chunk is a sub-control of a feed control. In this case the value of the feed control is used if it's not set. So it must be only set once on the feed control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sFeederSender: type: string, description: New value for property feederSender

sap.ui.ux3.Overlay.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Overlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getOpenButtonVisible openButtonVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getCloseButtonVisible closeButtonVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:openNew openNew} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

fireClosed.!description:
Fires event closed to attached listeners. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by using the preventDefault-method on the event object. Expects the following event parameters:
  • id of type stringThe ID of the Overlay instance.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup itself. Event is fired when one of the icon properties is modified (Note: The icon is not rendered by the ToolPopup). To be used by other controls which want to update the icon in their UI.

getAutoClose.!description: Gets current value of property autoClose. Determines whether the ToolPopup will auto close when it loses focus. If the user e.g. clicks outside of the ToolPopup it will be closed. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used. Default value is false.

setMaxHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property maxHeight. Forces a maximum height of the ToolPopup in pixels. If the ToolPopup content is higher than the ToolPopup, the content will be scrollable. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sMaxHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property maxHeight

detachClose.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the close event of this sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

setModal.!description: Sets a new value for property modal. Specifies whether the popup is modal and blocks any user-interaction with controls in the background. Changing this property while the ToolPopup is open will not have any effect. Please don't use "modal" and "autoclose" at the same time. In this case a warning will be prompted to the console and "autoclose" won't be used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bModal: type: boolean, description: New value for property modal

setInverted.!description: Sets a new value for property inverted. Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true the background and borders will be dark. If false they will be bright. This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bInverted: type: boolean, description: New value for property inverted

removeButton.!description: Removes a button from the aggregation buttons.

parameters.vButton: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The button to remove or its index or id

removeFocusableArea.!description: Removes an ID to the Popup that should be focusable as well when using autoclose. Chaining is only possible if a valid type (string) is given.

parameters.sID: type: string, description: ID of the corresponding element

close.!description:
Closes the pop up.
Can be called by the Shell when the pop up's button is clicked again; or by the application
when the interaction in the pop up has been completed or canceled.

parameters.bPreventRestoreFocus:
type: boolean, description: If set, the focus is NOT restored to the element that had the focus before the ToolPopup was opened.
        This makes sense when the ToolPopup is closed programmatically from a different area of the application
        (outside the ToolPopup) and the focus should not move aways from that place.

open.!description: Opens the ToolPopup. It is checked which control wants to open the ToolPopup. The Shell was previously set as parent so the corresponding parent element is used to set the correct position of the ToolPopup. If another control (i.e. a button) opens the ToolPopup, the control must be previously set as opener via setOpener to the ToolPopup. Corresponding to this opener the position of the ToolPopup will be set. It's also possible to set the position above, below or left from the opener. This can be done via the possible parameters my and at. These parameters refers to work the same way as they do of sap.ui.core.Popup.open.

parameters.at:
type: sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock, description: The "of" element's
reference point for docking to
parameters.my:
type: sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock, description: The ToolPopup's content
reference position for docking

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ToolPopup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconHover iconHover} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInverted inverted} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoClose autoClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ToolPopup.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Popup control.
A popup which the user can open from the Shell's tool pane. Generally, the starting point would be an icon. For this pop up, buttons can be defined with any text; therefore, it has the same purpose and similar look like any common dialog box. A ToolPopup can have any content. Depending on the application type and design, the structure of the texts and input fields can be for example form-like.

getDefaultButton.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association defaultButton, or null.

getOpener.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association opener, or null.

getInverted.!description: Gets current value of property inverted. Specifies whether the ToolPopup has a dark or bright background. If set to true the background and borders will be dark. If false they will be bright. This property only has an effect for the GoldReflection-theme. Default value is true.

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

getEnabled.!description:
Indicates whether the ToolPopup is currently enabled or not. Applications can't control the enabled state via a property. A ToolPopup is implicitly enabled depending on its openState. Descendant controls that honor the enabled state of their ancestors will appear disabled after the ToolPopup is closed. Since 1.13.1. Whether a dialog is regarded as "enabled" during the state transitions (OPENING, CLOSING) is not fully decided. Currently, it is enabled during the OPENING phase and disabled during the CLOSING phase. The only potential change would be to treat the OPENING phase as disabled as well. Applications should be prepared to receive events from "enabled" controls after they called open() on the dialog until close() is called on it. If the mentioned potential change should happen, the dialog will become enabled only after the transition to OPEN. Events from "enabled" children then can still only arrive between open() and close(), so applications that obey the previous rule should continue to work. Only end users or code that explicitly triggers pseudo user events would notice a difference.
A second aspect that might change is the visual behavior of the content: during the CLOSING phase it 'looks' enabled but in fact it is already disabled. This avoids unnecessary redraws for content that becomes hidden soon. Should this show to be confusing for end users, it might be changed.

setHref.!description: Sets a new value for property href. Defines the link target URL. This property is optional and should only be set when required! The use of the href property is to not only allow users to navigate in-place by left-clicking NavigationItems, but also to allow right-click and then "open in new tab" or "open in new window". As long as href is not set, an empty window will open and stay blank. But when href is set, the new window/tab will load this URL and it is the application's responsibility to display what the user expects (e.g. the Shell, with the respective NavigationItem being selected). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHref: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property href

sap.ui.ux3.DataSet.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DataSet. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFilter showFilter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSearchField showSearchField} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMultiSelect multiSelect} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetItem[]
    • {@link #getViews views} : sap.ui.ux3.DataSetView[]
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedView selectedView} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.DataSetView)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionChanged selectionChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ThingViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getSubtitle subtitle} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeaderType headerType} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewerHeaderType (default: Standard)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getHeaderContent headerContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getFacets facets} : sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem[]
    • {@link #getFacetContent facetContent} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingGroup[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedFacet selectedFacet} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.ux3.NavigationItem)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:facetSelected facetSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
ThingViewer: Same as ThingInspector but decoupled from the Overlay and the ActionBar. The control can be added to a Parent container that has a defined width. The ThingViewer fill the whole container. If the parent container has no width defined the control will not work properly.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ThingViewer itself. Event for facet selection. The application is responsible for displaying the correct content for the selected one. The ThingInspector will currently always mark the first facet as selected.

sap.ui.ux3.QuickView.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new QuickView. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitle firstTitle} : string
    • {@link #getFirstTitleHref firstTitleHref} : string
    • {@link #getSecondTitle secondTitle} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getShowActionBar showActionBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFavoriteActionEnabled favoriteActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUpdateActionEnabled updateActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFollowActionEnabled followActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFlagActionEnabled flagActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getOpenActionEnabled openActionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Element[]
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
    • {@link #getActionBar actionBar} : sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase#constructor sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase} can be used as well.

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExactBrowser. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderTitle headerTitle} : string
    • {@link #getTopListOrder topListOrder} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactOrder (default: Select)
    • {@link #getEnableListClose enableListClose} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getListHeight listHeight} : int (default: 290)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTopList showTopList} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableReset enableReset} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableSave enableSave} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTopListWidth topListWidth} : int (default: 168)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : sap.ui.ux3.ExactAttribute[] (default)
    • {@link #getOptionsMenu optionsMenu} : sap.ui.commons.Menu
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFollowUpControl followUpControl} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:attributeSelected attributeSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getEnableSave.!description: Gets current value of property enableSave. Whether the save button should be available in the header area. Default value is false.

attachAttributeSelected.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the attributeSelected event of this sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser itself. Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
attachAttributeSelected.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser itself

setEnableListClose.!description: Sets a new value for property enableListClose. Enables the close icons of the displayed lists. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableListClose: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableListClose

getShowHeader.!description: Gets current value of property showHeader. Whether the header area of the ExactBrowser should be shown. Default value is false.

getTopListOrder.!description: Gets current value of property topListOrder. The order how the sublists of the top level list should be displayed. Default value is Select.

attachSave.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the save event of this sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser itself. Event is fired when an attribute is selected or unselected.
attachSave.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser

sap.ui.ux3.ExactBrowser.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Attribute browse area used within the Exact pattern. The main benefit of this control is the high flexibility when large data amounts shall be displayed in the form of structured data sets with a high or low interdependency level. From lists - which can be nested according to the defined attributes - the user can choose entries and thereby trigger the display of further information, depending on the chosen entry/entries (multiple selection supported).

When the property is set to false the application must ensure to select top level attributes appropriately. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowTopList: type: boolean, description: New value for property showTopList

This event is thrown when the bar was resized (to the different valid states: Min, Max, Default, None). The event itself can be used from SAPUI5-version 1.12.2 since there was a bug in the previous versions firing this event.
attachResize.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar itself

getNotifiers.!description: Gets content of aggregation notifiers. Notifiers that monitor something within the application and display the corresponding notifications.

attachDisplay.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the display event of this sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar itself. Event is fired when the bar wants to be displayed depending on given flag. This allows the application to decide what to do.

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar itself

sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessagePopover control.
A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application. Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to. The NotificationBar uses position: fixed; to always stay at the bottom of the screen. This CSS may sometimes cause issues when nested deeply inside other controls. To have a proper behavior of the NotificationBar use it as high in the control hierarchy as possible.

addNotifier.!description: Adds some notifier to the aggregation notifiers.

parameters.oNotifier: type: sap.ui.core.Element, description: the notifier to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

detachResize.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the resize event of this sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

insertNotifier.!description: Inserts a notifier into the aggregation notifiers.

parameters.oNotifier: type: sap.ui.core.Element, description: the notifier to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the notifier should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the notifier is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the notifier is inserted at the last position

sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessagePopover control.
A NotificationBar is a "toolbar" that can be added to a page to show messages and notifications from the application. Its position, height and width is inherited from the element that the notification bar is added to. The NotificationBar uses position: fixed; to always stay at the bottom of the screen. This CSS may sometimes cause issues when nested deeply inside other controls. To have a proper behavior of the NotificationBar use it as high in the control hierarchy as possible.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.ux3.NotificationBar.

sap.ui.ux3.VisibleItemCountMode.!description: VisibleItemCountMode of the FacetFilter defines if the FacetFilter takes the whole available height (Auto) in the surrounding container, or is so high as needed to show 5 Items ("Fixed " - default).

Auto.!description: The FacetFilter automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleItemCount property is automatically changed accordingly.

Fixed.!description: The FacetFilter always has as many items in the FacetFilterList as defined in the visibleItemCount property.

getShowFollow.!description: Gets current value of property showFollow. Indicates whether social action “Follow” is shown, default is ‘true’ Default value is true.

getShowUpdate.!description: Gets current value of property showUpdate. Indicates whether social action “Update” is shown, default is ‘true’ Default value is true.

getDividerWidth.!description: Gets current value of property dividerWidth. The minimum width of ActionBar's the social actions part: business action controls have to be rendered outside this area

attachActionSelected.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the actionSelected event of this sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar itself. Fired when any of the social action’s toolbar buttons except ‘Update’ or any of the business action’s menu items resp. buttons is pressed. The selected action can be identified by its id and newState (the latter if applicable only) ‘Follow’ button + menu: id: follow, newState: Follow/Hold/Default ‘Mark for follow up’ button: id: flag, newState: true/false ‘Favorite’ button: id: favorite, newState: true/false ‘Open Thing Inspector’ button id: open Business Actions: id: the ThingAction id For ‘Update’, please refer to event ‘feedSubmit’

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ActionBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFollowState followState} : sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState (default: Default)
    • {@link #getFlagState flagState} : boolean
    • {@link #getFavoriteState favoriteState} : boolean
    • {@link #getUpdateState updateState} : boolean
    • {@link #getThingIconURI thingIconURI} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAlwaysShowMoreMenu alwaysShowMoreMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowUpdate showUpdate} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFollow showFollow} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFlag showFlag} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFavorite showFavorite} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowOpen showOpen} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDividerWidth dividerWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBusinessActions businessActions} : sap.ui.ux3.ThingAction[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:actionSelected actionSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:feedSubmit feedSubmit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setFollowState.!description: Sets a new value for property followState. Keeps track of the actionBars Follow/Unfollow button’s state. Its value is one of - FollowActionState.Default - FollowActionState.Follow - FollowActionState.Hold When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Default.

parameters.sFollowState: type: sap.ui.ux3.FollowActionState, description: New value for property followState

setThingIconURI.!description: Sets a new value for property thingIconURI. The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sThingIconURI: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property thingIconURI

getShowFavorite.!description: Gets current value of property showFavorite. Indicates whether social action “Favorite” is shown, default is ‘true’ Default value is true.

isActive.!description:
Checks whether the control is still valid (is in the DOM). ActionBar
instance is rendered if and only if 'isActive' returns 'true'. This
check is called implicitely by the rendere, MUST not be removed.

fireActionSelected.!description:
Fires event actionSelected to attached listeners. Expects the following event parameters:
  • id of type stringId of selected ThingAction
  • action of type sap.ui.ux3.ThingActionSelected ThingAction
  • newState of type stringNew State of the selected action.Only filled if the respective action maintains a state property, for example 'FollowUp' or 'Favorite'

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: The arguments to pass along with the event

getFlagState.!description: Gets current value of property flagState. Indicates whether “Mark for Follow Up” is active

setAlwaysShowMoreMenu.!description: Sets a new value for property alwaysShowMoreMenu. If true, business actions are rendered as menu items of the 'More' menu button. Otherwise, 'More' menu button is only displayed for overflow and business actions are rendered as inidividual buttons. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bAlwaysShowMoreMenu: type: boolean, description: New value for property alwaysShowMoreMenu

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar or sap.m.OverflowToolbar control.
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing. In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons. When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

setUpdateState.!description: Sets a new value for property updateState. Indicates whether “Update” is active When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.bUpdateState: type: boolean, description: New value for property updateState

getThingIconURI.!description: Gets current value of property thingIconURI. The thing icon uri. Icon will be displayed in Feeder

getShowFlag.!description: Gets current value of property showFlag. Indicates whether social action “Mark for Follow Up” is shown, default is ‘true’ Default value is true.

closePopups.!description:
Closes all popups which might be opened as ActionBar children
These are the more- and follow menu and the feeder popup

sap.ui.ux3.ActionBar.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Toolbar or sap.m.OverflowToolbar control.
A special toolbar with predefined social actions which can be shown as needed. These are: Create an update (Feed), Follow, Mark for Follow Up, Mark as Favorite and Open Thing. In addition business actions (ThingAction instances) can be added which are either displayed as MenuItems of the 'More' menu button or as individual tool bar buttons. When using this control, please be aware that it fulfills rather specific requirements: it has been designed for and is used within composite controls QuickView and ThingInspector.

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverlayDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.ux3.Overlay#constructor sap.ui.ux3.Overlay} can be used as well.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation content.

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property height. Determines the height of the Overlay Dialog. If the height is set to "auto" it is always 50% of the overlay height. Default value is auto.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Dialog implementation based on the Overlay. If used in a Shell it leaves the Tool-Palette, Pane-Bar and Header-Items accessible.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property width. Determines the width of the Overlay Dialog. If the width is set to "auto" it is always 50% of the overlay width. Default value is auto.

setOpenButtonVisible.!description: This Method is not supported for the OverlayDialog.

sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Dialog implementation based on the Overlay. If used in a Shell it leaves the Tool-Palette, Pane-Bar and Header-Items accessible.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.ux3.OverlayDialog.
